title: MikeJ_NpC
author: MikeJ_NpC
content: Hey,Just wondering if there is another way to calc for S and rewrite this and remove X if applicable s1=(((x*rr)+z1)%N) Thanks

comments.author: stwenhao
comments.body: Quoteand remove X if applicableDuh, you mean x=1? You want to remove it? Then, just do that. Which means, if you want to replace "x*rr" with "rr", then the conclusion is simply that "x=1".Seriously: if there would be a way, that would mean ECDSA would be broken. So, your question could be simplified into "is there another way to break ECDSA?".And the answer is also obvious: if there is no way, then nobody will tell you, how to do it. But if there is a way, then anyone, who will know the answer, will simply hide it. The incentive is just too big.Which means, in both cases, the answer is "no, you cannot do that".
